comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Flag is good-to-go on up to the gate. A little ice here and there, otherwise smooth sailing. And where the heck _are_ those Fair-Weather Frenz? Since the big snow, it's been lonely out here. I feel like Condaleeza Rice in a kissing booth. Very neglected. If it weren't for SB and Sir Brian Kent, I'd think they finally dropped the big one. Huge mushroom cloud - all bakery products one-half off! - and there I am, myopic and solo, cranking on up the hill. "Where'd everyone go?" Come on guys... tomorrow let's do some _sparring_!

comments.author: Bryan
comments.body: Let the road conditions and weather be no excuse tomorrow. It gets even drier above the gate because it's snow-packed instead of slush. Put those fenders on and throw a jacket in your pannier for the descent. Glad to Steve and Dave out there today. I was even more lonely last week. Bryan

comments.author: Linda
comments.body: Some people understand the concept of taking a break from the bike, letting the body recover, and not doing the same-old every day. Ha! Winter is for winter-time activities, not hill climbing on the bike. -ld

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: Linda, It's only bad if you go hard everday. :)D

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: That devil Bailey told me hill climbing on the bike WAS a winter activity. My wife might be right about him after all... he's a bad influence. DU
